items.definition: The process or state of being spoiled or destroyed
A person who watches what happens but has no active part in it
A particular area or part of the world, or any of the large official areas into which a country is divided
The opinion that people in general have about someone or something, or how much respect or admiration someone or something receives, based on past behaviour or character
A hard, transparent material, used to make windows, bottles, and other objects
The covering that forms the top of a building, vehicle, etc.
The leaves of a plant or tree, or leaves on the stems or branches on which they are growing
The climbing plant that produces grapes as its fruit
The way in which the parts of a system or object are arranged or organized, or a system arranged in this way
A group of people who are related to each other, such as a mother, a father, and their children
The area of a town that surrounds someone's home, or the people who live in this area
An area of land, together with a house and buildings, used for growing crops and/or keeping animals as a business
A mistake, especially something for which you are to blame
A covered structure in front of the entrance to a building
The outer or furthest point of something
The stick-like central part of a plant that grows above the ground and from which leaves and flowers grow, or a smaller thin part that grows from the central part and supports the leaves and flowers
One of the flat, usually green parts of a plant that are joined at one end to the stem or branch
An extreme weather condition with very strong wind, heavy rain, and often thunder and lightning
Something that exists and can be seen, felt, tasted, etc., especially something unusual or interesting
The careful and detailed examination of something in order to get information about it
The thick main stem of a tree, from which its branches grow
Something that is interesting because it is rare and unusual
A person who sees an event happening, especially a crime or an accident
The state of things as they are, rather than as they are imagined to be
An idea, plan, or action that is suggested or the act of suggesting it
Any of the thin parts like thread that form plant or artificial material, esp. those that can be made into cloth, or a mass of such parts twisted together
The material on the surface of the ground in which plants grow
The development of something into a particular thing or shape
A large system consisting of many similar parts that are connected together to allow movement or communication between or along the parts, or between the parts and a control centre
The fact that two people or things look like each other or are similar in some other way
An arm or leg of a person or animal
Any of the five separate parts at the end of the foot
A group of objects that have been put in a particular order or position
The front of the head, where the eyes, nose, and mouth are
A belief or opinion that you develop from the information that you know
A feeling of being excited, or an exciting event
Someone who is trained to listen to people and give them advice about their problems
A person with responsibility for protecting or taking care of something or keeping something in good condition
A plant, root, seed, or pod that is used as food, especially in dishes that are not sweet
The act of making something known that was secret, or a fact that is made known
